arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: This forms a portion of collection #5488 B. The guide to the entire collection is available here.

Series XCVII is arranged in 1 sub-series by Union file number.
Series XCVIII is arranged 169 in sub-series by Union file number.

did.unittitle: Invitation of Brotherhood by City of St. Louis, Missouri
Oppose Congressmen Who Attempt to Suppress Labor and Curtail Gains Made by Labor in Past Eight Years
Sub-Series 477-1. 1943 Convention. Grand President's Convention Report
Sub-Series 477-2. 1943 Convention. Economic Security in Post-War Period
Sub-Series 477-2. 1943 Convention. Report of Committee on Legislation.
Bring War to Successful Conclusion and More Secure Economy Thereafter
When Officers of Brotherhood Are Accused of Violation of Company Rules, Brotherhood Officials to Be Permitted to Sit in Judgment With Company Official and Be Granted Equal Power
Local Chairmen and Other Representatives Shall Be Allowed on Company Property at Any Time if Such Visit is For Purpose of Seeing That Company is Living Up to Working Agreemen.
Additional Penalty For Work Performed Beyond a Full Day's Assignment On Holidays or Days of Rest
Carriers Should Be Required to Bulletin Vacation Relief Clerks' Jobs When Such Assignments Are For More than 30 Days' Duration.
Amend Article 45 of Grand Lodge Constitution to Provide for Referendum Ballot for Election of System or District Board of Adjustment Officers
Amend Death Benefit Department Laws to Permit Naming of Persons Other than Relatives as Beneficiaries
Committee on Finance, Salaries, Mileage and Per Diem
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to Provide Disability and Sickness Annuity After 20 Years' Service
Secure Sick Leave Rules in All Working Agreements
Pension After 30 Years' Service Regardless of Age
Compulsory Retirement at 65 Years of Age, and at 60 After 30 Years' Service; With Minimum Annuity of $100 Per Month
Increase Weekly Benefits Under State Workmen's Compensation.
Widow and Children Benefits; Disability Annuity After 15 Years' Service; Full Annuity After Age 60 Rather Than 65
Carrier Service Only to Be Used in Determining Annuity
Fifty Per Cent of Pensioner's Annuity to Go to Widow
Amend Railway Labor Act to Limit Waiting Period on Wage Negotiations, etc., to 60 Days
40-Hour Week With No Reduction in Compensation.
Employees Working at Night to Be Paid at a Rate of 10 Cents Per Hour Above Day Rates
Horse, Scenery and Unfit Cars for Express Messengers
Lasting Worldwide Peace Based on a Well-Balanced Economy
Use of Radio by Grand President to Educate General Public in Furtherance of Labor's Cause
Equalization of Rates of Pay in Express Superintendent's Office, Long Island Division.
Remove Addendum A From Express Agreement
Labor Representatives Be Permitted to Participate in Peace Conference
40-hour Week With Time and One-Half Thereafter
Express Drivers and Helpers Not Be Required to Work Under Police Protection Nor Cross Picket Lines
40-hour Week for All Employees Under Jurisdiction of Brotherhood
Double Time for Work Performed on All Legal Holidays and Sundays; On Regular 7-Day Assignments, Time and One-Half for Work Performed on All Legal Holidays and Sundays
Revise National Vacation Agreement So All Employees Under Jurisdiction of Brotherhood Will Receive 12 Days' Vacation Per Year
Secure National Rule to Provide that Carriers Be Required to Add to All Monetary Awards Interest at Current Rate From Date Claim Is Filed to Date of Actual Payment of Award
Revise National Vacation Agreement to provide two weeks' vacation for all employees covered by Brotherhood agreements
Minimum guarantee of 8 hours' work per day
Eliminate subnormal conditions on New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad
40-hour week with time and one-half for sixth day and double time for seventh day of work
Revise Express Agreement to provide payment of salary to Express Managers on mileage and hourly basis
Equalization of rates of pay for performance of identical duties
Revise Express Agreement to require Agency to place Express Messenger on trains carrying express in cars either open or sealed
Stop farming out of Express Messengers' work to various members of train crews
Inclusion of Express workers in Canada within the confines of the Brotherhood
Sick leave and vacation with pay based on seniority and not on class of work done by a member
Provide death benefit insurance for members' of Ladies' Auxiliary
Grab irons or steps for refrigerator cars
New members eligible to vote for Delegates-at-large
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to compel retirement at age 65; permit retirement at age 60 after 30 years' service with full pension after 30 years' service
Time and one-half after 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week; double-time on seventh day of week
Time and one-half after 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week; double-time on seventh day of week
Reaffirm policy set forth in Resolution No. 98 adopted at Toronto Convention, 1939
Inclusion of excepted and personal office force positions
Better coordination and cooperation efforts of Boards of Adjustment and Local Lodges
More efficient handling of grievances and matters involving application and interpretation of agreements
Off-job and On-job training program to meet war manpower problem
Military service leave of absence for System Board and Local Lodge officers
Delegates required to pay transportation to and from Convention to be reimbursed for this expenditure
Amend Retirement and Unemployment Insurance Acts
Eliminate various classes in working agreements
Make non-telegraph agencies available to Clerks
Restore Rate Clerk positions to Brotherhood jurisdiction. 1943
Extend seniority district of Boise Lodge No. 1019
Urge Senate to declare determination of United States to work for lasting peace with equal rights for all
Endorse President F.D. Roosevelt for reelection.
Demand program to protect workers from unemployment and its attendant evils
Provide for vacation payments to members in armed forces
Seek legislation to maintain proper differential between wages and cost of living
Eliminate clause "without additional expense to the company" from sick leave rule
Equalize Express rate of pay in New York City with higher rates in other industries
Demand 40-hour week, with time and one-half for sixth day and double-time for seventh day of week
Claim Brotherhood jurisdiction of all agent and assistant agent positions at non-telegraph stations
Reaffirms Toronto Convention Resolution No. 101, calling for punitive rates for overtime, Sunday, and holiday work
Grand Lodge to furnish annual financial statement
Waive all dues of members in armed forces
Grand President to insist on vote by Congress on Pending Workmen's Compensation Law and report progress monthly
Change service requirement of Railroad Retirement Act in connection with physical disability to 20 years
Eliminate the word "white" from Brotherhood Constitution.
Eliminate the word "white" from Brotherhood Constitution.
Require Lodges not having 150 members under one System Board to vote for Delegate-at-Large
Establish State or Provincial Legislative Committees, Grand Lodge to contribute not more than three cents per member
Endorse President F.D. Roosevelt as "peace-maker" even to the extent of a fourth term
Request Grand President to continue efforts to do away with unsafe and unsanitary express cars
Amend Express Agreement to provide 15 days' sick leave and 15 days' vacation after 2 years
Equalize rates of pay of mail handlers employed by railroads with rates paid by Government for similar work
Serve notice for change in vacation agreement to provide two weeks' vacation and sick leave for all railroad employees
Establish higher rates for night work than for day work
Liberalize the Railroad Retirement Act to allow physically disqualified employees full pension after 30 years' service
Retirement permitted after 30 years' service, regardless of age
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide minimum pension of $100; widow to get $100 until death or remarriage
Demand 15 days' sick leave for all employees represented by Brotherhood
Demand two weeks' vacation for all laborers under Clerks' Agreement
Brotherhood to require that railroads furnish detailed statement of deductions from paycheck
Establish uniform rates of pay for similar work in a particular district
Distribute officers of Boards of Adjustment equally among lodges under jurisdiction of such Boards of Adjustment
Require three years' continuous membership before election as officer or member of Protective Committee
Grand President to seek changes in Rules 68, 70, and 75(b) of Express Agreement
Amend Rule 21 of Express Agreement, to require employees transferring to other districts to stay 90 days or until seniority is exhausted
Eliminate short-hour provision from Express Agreement
Amend Rules 53 and 55 and Addendum A, Express Agreement
Change "short-turn-around" rule in Express Agreement to 150 miles
Request two weeks' vacation after three years' service for all members
Night work should be paid for at 10 per cent above the prevailing rate for day work
Amend sick leave rule in Richmond, Fredericksburg, and Potomac Railroad Agreement
Brotherhood demands jurisdiction over all freight handling in railroad warehouses
Change method of payment for handling United States mail
Discourage practice of requiring express managers to store freight at stations where no agent is on duty
Lend every effort to obtain passage of Federal Workmen's Compensation Act
Amend Railroad Retirement Act to provide pensions after 30 years' service, 60 years of age or after 20 years' service in physical disability cases
Amend Grand Lodge Constitution, Article 45, Section 8(b), to require General Chairmen to comply with Roberts' Rules of Order in System Board meetings
Amend Article 45, Section 15(a), to restrict per capita tax to System Boards to two-thirds of tax paid to Grand Lodge
Amend Grand Lodge Constitution, Article 45, Section 8(b) to require General Chairmen to open office to any member under jurisdiction of System Board
Amend Grand Lodge Constitution, Article 45, Section 5(a), to make formation of division protective committees compulsory
Establish legislative department in Grand Lodge and outline duties thereof
Vacation Agreement to provide vacations for employees in military service, the same as if in railroad service
Make Good Friday a legal holiday
That 35 years' service be sufficient for pension
Employees returning from military service be given vacation in year of return provided that they have 160 days' military service in that year
Request for draft deferment be approved by a joint labor-management committee before approval by a draft board
Brotherhood cooperate with other organizations to require management to furnish itemized statements of payroll deductions
If and when 40-hour week is secured, no employee shall be reduced below six days per week without increase in basic rate

Discipline to be administered only after hearing before an equal number of representatives of employee and management, with neutral referee, and that employee be permitted to continue working until investigation is held
Payments for illness or disability by Railroad Retirement Board after 30 days' absence from duty
Increase pensions of those already retired because of increased cost of living
Reinstate members who have been suspended while in military service without loss of benefits under the Death Benefit Department
General Chairmen to be required to make monthly report to each lodge under his jurisdiction.
Piece work and/or bonus system to be eliminated in Chicago switching district; rates of pay to be equalized and freight houses to be closed at 1:30 pm on Saturdays
Authorize Grand Executive Council to postpone 1947 Convention not to exceed one year after end of war, if national interest requires such postponement
Express appreciation to the railroads, hotels and other organizations in St. Louis, Missouri
Express appreciation to the City of St. Louis local committee and District Council
